page.title: 17Flower Show:The Deverills
page.content: On Saturday 6th July the{Crockerton {and Deverill Valley Horticultural {Society }held its annual show. There were many attractions. The exhibition of fruit and vegetable produce,flowers and the classes for handi-crafts and cookery and special children's classes were held in two enormous barns. In an adjacent field there was a tractor reversing competition, a tug-of-war, a clay pigeon shoot and several side shows for children. The dog show was popular with classes for the dog with the waggiest tail, the scruffiest dog and the dog most like its owner. Cream teas were served and the Bratton Silver Band added to the pleasant atmosphere playing throughout the afternoon.There were many visitors, among them Lord and Lady Bath. The sun shone and all afternoon hay-making progressed far across the field.
